intro: Fimbristylis bahiensis, commonly known as the Bahia sedge, is a flowering plant belonging to the Cyperaceae family. It is native to South America, particularly Brazil, and thrives in wetland and marshy environments. The plant features slender, grass-like stems with narrow, linear leaves arranged in a dense cluster. Its small, inconspicuous flowers are typically clustered in spikelets, and it produces tiny, three-lobed seeds. Fimbristylis bahiensis plays a role in stabilizing wetland soils and providing habitat for various aquatic organisms.
